relation: From 紫雲英 Genge, Chinese milk vetch. Also similar to 玄米 genmai, unmilled rice.
From mais, maize. From Latin faba, bean.
현 hyeon is a Korean reading of 玄, read as gen in Japanese.
From 亞朗 Yǎlǎng (Sir Aaron) and 玄米 genmai.
pageTitle: Riley - Bulbapedia, the community-driven Pokémon encyclopedia
textBeforeTable: Names The design of the necklace Riley wears is the same as the pattern on Sir Aaron's gloves. It's also the same as the pattern on Groudon's arm. Riley has many similarities with Sir Aaron from Lucario and the Mystery of Mew. In addition to design similarities, both Trainers have a Lucario and can use Aura. Riley is the only human in the games confirmed to be able to use Aura, as displayed in his intro animation and through a line of in-battle speech where he mentions feeling the player's Aura. In the anime, he is one of two known and currently living human users of Aura, the other being Ash. Of all the potential partners in the Battle Tower, Riley has the largest pool of Pokémon to choose from. Trivia Serious Training on Iron Island!! Debut Lucario is Riley's only known Pokémon. He trained it while on Iron
